betterquesting:10.desc:8: You'll want to be chopping some wood to get started. Let's say 16 logs.
Tinkers' Construct provides the means to create tools that can be repaired. Make the tables and pattern chest required to get started!

You may be wondering how to get started with Ars Magica 2. The Arcane Compendium will guide you through the mod, but how to get one in the first place?

Firstly you are going to want to acquire some Etherium. In this version of Ars Magica 2, you obtain some by using an §9Etherium Extractor§9§9§r on Witchwood trees with empty buckets in your inventory.

Then use those buckets of Etherium to create a small pool (2x2 is enough), place a block and item frame to the side of it, and then place a book inside the item frame.

An animation will play and after a few seconds you have yourself an §5Arcane Compendium§r!

You may have noticed you cannot break any ores with your Stone/Wooden tools. Your first objective is to create a §7§8Flint Pickaxe§r. It will start off being able to mine stone but as you mine with it, it will increase mining level by 1 so you can mine copper.

You can repair the tool by using the crafting material with the tool in a crafting grid (eg: Flint)
You probably started with all these guidebooks in your inventory. Probably want a place to store them. Here is one of 3 options.

To make the next tier of Tinkers' tool (Copper) you'll need a smeltery. A smeltery is a large, expandable structure that can melt down ores and ingots into molten metal.

To construct a simple smeltery structure with a 3x3 interior and 1 block high, place a 3x3 base of §8Seared Bricks§r (preferably sunken into the floor), then on the front outside face place the §8Smeltery Controller§r and two §8Seared Drains§r. You can place the §8Seared Glass§r or §8Seared Tank§r on the side, and fill it with lava using a §4Clay Bucket§r. Fill the rest of the outside edge with §8Seared Bricks§r (you can skip the corners).

The reward gives you enough to expand the smeltery to 2 blocks high.
Break grass to get seeds to start your farm (you're going to run out of food otherwise)

While exploring the world you may come across an IndustrialCraft 2 Rubber tree. You can see on the sides there are these little golden holes - these when clicked on with a treetap, will give you §e§r§6Sticky Resin§r that can then be turned into rubber, useful for all sorts of IC2 machines.
You can then use stone tool pieces (eg: §8Stone Pickaxe Head§r), pour §6Aluminum Brass§r onto them with a §8Casting Table§r to create a Cast that can then be used to make a Copper Pickaxe Head.

You will need a §cLava Bucket§r to power the Smeltery from Tinkers' Construct (next quest). Iguana Tinkers Tweaks allows you to make buckets from Clay so you don't have to wait until Iron.

Put the §7Unfired Clay Bucket§r in a furnace.
Make other types of casts that will be useful. Use a §8Seared Brick§r to make the Ingot cast.

You know the drill now. Add the Copper Pickaxe Head to your existing pickaxe (keep in mind you must fully repair it first), mine until you get §6+1 Mining Level§r, mine some Iron, make an §4Iron Pickaxe Head§r, mine some Tin.
The next level of mining can be most easily achieved by making Bronze, an alloy of Copper and Tin.
With the power of the smeltery unlocked, you can upgrade your Tool Station into a §eTool Forge§r which allows you to create even more types of tools!
Make some tough tools

Tired of lugging about multiple lava buckets to fill up your smeltery? §b§1Mekanism§r provides tanks that can act as as a bucket to scoop up fluids as well! The basic tier holds 14 buckets worth of fluid.

You can switch between modes with Shift + N (or your setting in keybinds called Mekanism Item Mode Switch)

You'll be doing a lot of mining as you level up your Tinkers' tools (and the ores you can mine), so why not craft some specialised backpacks to carry more stuff! The two you will want for mining are the §1Miner's Backpack§r (for ores) and the §9Digger's Backpack§r (for cobblestones).

If you don't have enough string, you can grow some §k§r§l§r§dCotton§r from Natura or §dFlax§r from Actually Additions.

You can Shift + Right Click while holding the backpack to change its mode. §6Normal§r automatically picks up allowed items, §6Locked§r disables auto-pickup, §6Receiving§r collects eligible items from other inventories, and §6Resupply§r automatically refills a stack of an item in your hotbar or inventory as you use it.

You can also Shift + Right Click a chest with the backpack to empty it.
Tired of waiting for all of your crops to grow? Make a watering can! Fill it up with water and right click on crops to water them, they will grow much faster.
You will need 2 §8Coal Dust§r and 1 §7Iron Ingot§r for each Steel Ingot worth of Molten Steel you produce.

The next mining level requires either §dPig Iron§r, §8Steel§r, §bHSLA Steel§r or §9Osmium§r (but you probably want to save your Osmium for Mekanism machines). Let's go with Steel. There are many ways to make Steel, but with Tinkers' Construct you are going to want to mix Iron with §8Liquefacted Coal§r in a smeltery.

That's where the §bQuartz Grindstone§r comes in. It can grind down ores into dusts, including coal, and coal dust can be melted in a smeltery to make Liquefacted Coal. Craft a Quartz Grindstone with a §6Wooden Crank§r now and try it.

Most machines in Thermal Expansion require some sort of power, Thermal Expansion uses Redstone Flux (RF) as its power units. §8Steam Dynamos§r will allow you to generate RF with Coal. You just need to fill them with water.

Tired of manually grinding ores into dusts with the §bQuartz Grindstone§r? The §1Pulverizer§r can process ores into dusts at the cost of RF, and can also be upgraded into Hardened, Reinforced and Resonant tiers. One ore gives two dust.
Starting the early game in Minecraft
Getting started in Ars Magica 2
Industrialise your world!
A mod with many 1-block machines and useful items
